content: #241 thermal cap designed by kate salomon this hat is as light as a feather and almost as warm as down when temperatures drop inviting you to reach for additional layers this slouchy cap will be the perfect choice the garter ridges create a thermal feel that will keep you warm and cozy we ve designed it with a classic simple texture that has unisex appeal we hope that you ll make two and share the warmth finished measurements 18 circumference 9 ½ deep blocked and slightly stretched gauge 26 sts and 15 row per 4 / 10cm in blocked garter stitch with smaller needle for accuracy check gauge and adjust needle size if necessary yarn 1 skein simply fine or approx 450 yards of fingering weight yarn please note one skein provides enough yardage to make 2 hats needles us 2 /2 75 mm & us 5 /3 75 mm 16 circular needle or longer for magic loop and or dpns notions stitch marker glossary pm = place marker round = round k2tog = knit 2 sts together bor = beginning of round sl1 = slip st purlwise with yarn in back instructions cast on 120 sts with larger needle and join to work in the round placing a bor marker switch to smaller needles and begin pattern repeat slipped stitch garter rib pattern round 1 knit all sts round 2 p5 sl 1 * repeat to end of round work for approx 2 13 garter ridges ending with round 1 of pattern change to larger needles and continue with rib pattern as established until hat measures 8 or to desired length ending with round 2 of pattern for a medium slouch work until hat stands approximately 1-2 inches above the top of the head please note that the crown decreases will add 2 to overall length when blocked switch to using dpns or a longer circular needle for magic loop as needed to work crown decreases crown decreases row 1 k10 k2tog * repeat to
